## ðŸ”’ You Donâ€™t Own Your Work If You Canâ€™t Take It With You

Most creators assume ownership because they can still log in. But access is not ownership, and convenience is not custody. This essay examines why true ownership only exists when your work can survive platforms, policies, accounts, and time â€” and why sovereignty begins the moment export stops being optional.

tags: ðŸ”’ You Donâ€™t Own Your Work If You Canâ€™t Take It With You

Most creators assume ownership because they can still log in. But access is not ownership, and convenience is not custody. This essay examines why true ownership only exists when your work can survive platforms, policies, accounts, and time â€” and why sovereignty begins the moment export stops being optional.
